document.write('<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://gist.github.com/stylesheets/gist/embed.css"/>')





document.write('<div id=\"gist-318945\" class=\"gist\">\n  \n  \n    \n            \n            \n            \n            \n            \n            \n            \n\n      <div class=\"gist-file\">\n        <div class=\"gist-data gist-syntax\">\n          \n          \n          \n            <div class=\"gist-highlight\"><pre><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC1\">gzip on;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC2\">gzip_min_length 1100;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC3\">gzip_buffers 4 8k;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC4\">gzip_proxied any;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC5\">gzip_types      text/plain text/html text/css application/x-javascript text/xml application/xml application/xml+rss text/javascript;[/code]<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC6\"><br/><\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC7\">If you&#39;re looking to set some expiry headers to images, etc in nginx try this.<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC8\"><br/><\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC9\">[code]location ~* ^.+\\.(jpg|jpeg|gif|png|ico|css|zip|tgz|gz|rar|bz2|doc|xls|exe|pdf|ppt|txt|tar|mid|midi|wav|bmp|rtf|js|mov)$ {<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC10\">expires 30d;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC11\">break;<\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC12\"><br/><\/div><div class=\"line\" id=\"LC13\">}<\/div><\/pre><\/div>\n          \n        <\/div>\n\n        <div class=\"gist-meta\">\n          <a href=\"http://gist.github.com/raw/318945/20fa15840632a4e79fb8c51f36e4e3e55d8effbd/gistfile7.txt\" style=\"float:right;\">view raw<\/a>\n          <a href=\"http://gist.github.com/318945#file_gistfile7.txt\" style=\"float:right;margin-right:10px;color:#666\">gistfile7.txt<\/a>\n          <a href=\"http://gist.github.com/318945\">This Gist<\/a> brought to you by <a href=\"http://github.com\">GitHub<\/a>.\n        <\/div>\n      <\/div>\n    \n            \n  \n<\/div>\n')
